original_title: Decision to appoint IGP was constitutional - Speaker tells Parliament
original_body_lines: The Speaker of the Parliament Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena has informed the Parliament that the decision to appoint the Inspector General of Police (IGP) was correct, legal, constitutional, and made in good faith.
He further said that the situation with regard to the IGP cannot be resolved even by the President, and the matter must be sorted out in court if necessary.
